metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Westerville. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Patrick J McHale, CFP®|CIMA®

heroDescription: Westerville, Ohio, is a vibrant community known for its rich history and strong local economy.
landscapeDescription: Westerville's economy is diverse, with a focus on healthcare, education, and retail. The city benefits from its proximity to Columbus, enhancing its growth potential.
uniqueNeeds: Westerville requires tailored financial services to support its growing population and diverse industries.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Westerville's healthcare and education sectors face competition risks. Real estate prices are rising, indicating potential bubble concerns. Prepare for flooding risks and diversify investments.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Westerville's economy has grown steadily, driven by healthcare and education sectors, with a GDP growth rate of 3.5%.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in Westerville is approximately $78,000, reflecting a stable and affluent community.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Westerville increasingly specialize in retirement planning and wealth management, catering to a growing retiree population.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Westerville's cost of living is slightly above the national average, driven by housing and healthcare costs.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Westerville's real estate market is competitive, with home prices increasing by 7% year-over-year, raising affordability concerns.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Westerville's business climate is favorable, with supportive local policies and a growing number of startups and small businesses.
